review: Interesting device, I loved the idea of having something that can wireless receive HDMI signals from other devices.  The downside is Google has locked this down so it's limited to a few apps.  For the iOS users you can only stream You Tube and Google Play (at this time).  You can't just stream anything you want from your PC to the Chromecast, it's limited as well.  There are "hacked" versions of this device out there that allow a lot more flexibility in what it can do. (I know have one).If you just need something that can play Netflix, HBO GO, Hulu or Pandora and that's all you really want for now, this is a cheap way to get high quality streaming video over WiFi!  If you want to stream anything and everything, this isn't there yet.Note, this product will continually update with new firmware so it's possible things improve and new features continue to be added to the device.
author: S. Shah "Hi-Fi 4 Ever"

review: This is exactly what I wanted out of my bedroom tv: play Netflix easily, play YouTube easily, play Pandora easily.Cons:-Black colors don't look great on Netflix or YouTube - lots of artifacts.-Apps sometimes crash on your device when casting to Chromecast.  When that happens - you have to load back up the app you were using and connect again to get controls working - like pausing a video.Beyond that I really enjoy Chromecast and would recommend it for anyone wanting an easy way to play their media from their Android device.
